result.execSummary:
The defendant James S. Nicoll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James S. Nicoll is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James S. Nicoll was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • James S. Nicoll was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • James S. Nicoll was found guilty of Negligent Handling of Burning Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court
Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

No contact with victim except as permitted by the agent.

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Do no possess or consume alcohol.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- or 26-week domestic abuse program.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  No restitution requested or ordered.

In addition the costs that the Court has ordered paid as a condition of probation, the Defendant will be ordered to reimburse Richland County for the costs of Dean counsel (appointed defense counsel) in this case.  Once the final bill is known for those services, the Clerk of Court will communicate to the Defendant the amount that is owed to Richland County. Attorney reimbursement fees shall be paid directly to the Clerk of Court.  The Clerk of Court will use all means necessary to collect these fees for Richland County.

* JOC AMENDED 3-11-16 with known amount of Dean counsel bill:  $1293.98.  Richland County is paying this amount to Attorney Curtis Johnson.  Defendant is ordered to reimburse Richland County the full $1293.98 with payment of this debt to be made directly to the Clerk of Court.  Judge Sharp has ordered this amount due immediately.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Disposition of warrant or commitment- Time Served

15CF113/sentencing after revocation, 20CF2/status, and 20TR50/status. 01:25 PM Defendant James S. Nicoll in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. McDougal notes that the parties are still awaiting results from the crime lab before proceeding in 20CF2 and 20TR50. Proceeding today with sentencing after revocation in 15CF113 on counts 3, 4, and 6. Sentence: 

count 3 - 9 mo with huber, concurrent with any other time serving
count 4 - 90 days, concurrent, with huber
count 6 - 9 months, concurrent, with huber

Credit: 141 days credit

20CF2 and 20TR50 adjourned to 7/1 at 3 for status.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 20, 2020 at 01:00 pm.

for Discharge of Defense Counsel and Disbursement of Fees (submitted to Accts. Payable 3/11/16)

Defendant James S. Nicoll in court, in custody, with attorney Curtis Johnson for 15CF113 and 16CF14. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution of these matters - disposition will include def's pleas to four misdemeanor counts - counts 3, 4, and 6 in 15CF113 and count 1, amended to misd. bail jumping, in 16CF14.  Court allows the amendment of the bail j charge in 16CF14.  Def pleads no contest to the four counts stated.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  16CF14 - time served - time to be calculated by the jail.  (After the hearing, Atty. Johnson reports to the clerk that he has checked with the jail and the "time served" sentence should reflect 52 days credit.)

15CF113 - sentence withheld for probation of 2 years.  Conditions:  no contact with victim except as permitted by agent; submit to AODA and follow through with recommendations; do not possess or consume alcohol; do not possess or consume controlled substances without valid prescription; attend, pay for, and successfully complete 24 to 26 week d.a. program.  Costs to be paid as condition of probation.

No restitution requested.

Atty. J notes that the plea questionnaire submitted indicated that def was pleading to bail jumping in 15CF113 but that is not correct - def is pleading to bail jumping, as amended to misdemeanor, in 16CF14.

ADA Forehand asks that bail be vacated in the case she has decided not to file.  So ordered.
Preliminary hearing at 02-24-2016 11:00 am
Def from jail
Preliminary hearing at 02-24-2016 11:00 am

Defendant James S. Nicoll appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail for adj. initial in 15CF113 and initial in 16CF14. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Curtis Johnson in court for Defendant James S. Nicoll.  Atty. J requests formal reading of the complaint; asks that both matters be set for prelim in 3-4 weeks, waiting time limits for prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.
No contact with Shelley L. Mills n/k/a Shelley L. Nicoll (DOB: 5/27/1972) or her residence.
The judge called this case during bail hearing on 1/04/2016 and reinstated the $5,000 cash bond.

Court admits def to $5000 signature bond with condition that he's to have no contact with SLM 5-27-72 or her residence.  Additionally, def under curfew arrest at mother's home, not to leave there unless he has a medically-mandated appointment, procedure, or other medical reason to be out.  If out for one of those reasons, must be in the company of his mother.

Defendant James S. Nicoll in court, in custody, with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 

Court states charges, noting that complaint does not contain a "Count 1" - starts with "Count 2."

Court informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as def's rights including right to prelim. 

Atty. Johnson states that the def will waive the prelim time limits on the felony charges and enter NG pleas on the misdemeanors.

Def asks the Court for court appointment of Atty. Johnson.  Def has Johnson as Dean counsel in Iowa County case; is not eligible for SPD.  Court questions def to determine eligibility for Dean counsel appointment.  Court appoints Atty. C Johnson as Dean counsel and explains to def that he will have to repay Richland County.  Def is to pay $50/mo with first payment Jan. 15, 2016.  

Bond amendment requested and ordered:  Court admits def to $5000 signature bond with condition that he's to have no contact with SLM 5-27-72 or her residence.  Additionally, def under curfew arrest at mother's home, not to leave there unless he has a medically-mandated appointment, procedure, or other medical reason to be out.  If out for one of those reasons, must be in the company of his mother.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
